meanings.sent1: The roots of the tree ramify in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The river ramifies into smaller streams as it flows through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the surprise party ramifies quickly through the school.
meanings.sent4: Her influence ramifies through the community like a spiderweb.
meanings.sent5: The idea of kindness ramifies, touching every heart it encounters.

meanings.definition: To divide into branches or subdivisions
meanings.sent1: The company plans to ramify its operations to reach more customers.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to ramify their estate among the siblings.
meanings.sent3: The recipe ramifies when you add more ingredients than needed.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts ramify into countless possibilities, like a maze in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The decision to move abroad ramifies into various logistical challenges.
